title: Drake ‘looked excited’ when Rihanna arrived at his 34th birthday party
text:
Drake and RiRi are back on friendly terms (Picture: Rex; GC Images)

It seems Drake doesn’t mind being in the friend-zone after all as he reportedly couldn’t stop smiling when his former bestie and on/off lover Rihanna rocked up to his 34th birthday party this week.

The In My Feelings rapper hosted a celebratory bash at Poppy nightclub in Hollywood on Tuesday night ahead of his 34th birthday on Thursday (24 October).

According to eyewitnesses, Rihanna made a special appearance at the party much to Drake’s delight.

It’s been years since the pair have been spotted together after Rihanna, 31, admitted they had grown apart. The musicians had famously dated on and off for several years but RiRi eventually put an end to their romance and she’s now happily dating billionaire businessman Hassan Jameel.

But it sounds as though they’ve put the past behind them and are back on friendly terms again.

A source told E! News: ‘Rihanna made an appearance and stayed for several hours. She was with two girlfriends and was escorted to Drake’s table by security.

‘Her and Drake were talking for a while and were smiling and laughing. It seemed like a very pleasant interaction and they looked like they were having fun together as friends.’

The awkward moment (Picture: Rex Features)

The insider reveals it was nothing but good vibes between Drizzy and RiRi, who let her hair down and enjoyed a good ol’ dance in the VIP section.

‘Rihanna was dancing to the music and bobbing her head and seemed to be in a good mood. The whole vibe was very chill,’ the eyewitness continued.

‘Drake had a huge smile on his face and looked excited to see Rihanna when she arrived.’

It was the beginning of the end of their close friendship in 2016 when Drake delivered an overly complimentary speech to RiRi while presenting her with the Vanguard Award at the MTV VMAs.

In the speech, Drake said: ‘She’s someone I’ve been in love with since I was 22-years-old. She’s one of my best friends in the world. All my adult life, I’ve looked up to her, even though she’s younger than me.

‘She’s a living, breathing legend in our industry.’

Rihanna stood beside him looking visibly uncomfortable and later admitted the awkward moment prompted her to put a distance between them.

Addressing their relationship in an interview with Vogue later that year, RiRi said: ‘We don’t have a friendship now, but we’re not enemies either. It is what it is.

‘Waiting through that speech was probably the most uncomfortable part. I don’t like too many compliments. I don’t like to be put on blast.’
